page.title: 13NEWTON QUARRY
page.content:
NEWTON QUARRY STOPPED PRODUCTION ABOUT 5 YEARS AGO. THE SANDSTONE FROM HERE WAS USED FOR FAMOUS BUILDINGS, SUCH AS ST. ANDREW'S HOUSE IN EDINBURGH AND THE CAIRD HALL IN DUNDEE. THE STONE WAS FORMERLY TAKEN BY CART TO EDROM STATION. THE OLD CRANES AND STONE CUTTING SHED ARE STILL THERE. THERE IS ALSO A CROW BAR NEEDING TWO MEN TO LIFT IT.
NOW THE QUARRY IS A WILD QUIET PLACE, FULL OF TREES AND PLANTS, WHERE BIRDS AND ANIMALS LIVE UNDISTURBED. THE FARMER WATCHED FOX CUBS PLAYING HERE. THERE ARE TWO PONDS WHERE TWO GOLDFISH, SET FREE BY A HOLIDAY MAKER WHO WON THEM AT A FAIR, HAVE GROWN QUITE LARGE. THERE ARE ALSO A LOT OF BEEHIVES BECAUSE OF THE SURROUNDING FIELDS OF OILSEED RAPE, WHICH THE BEES LIKE.
